sql-set.sql: select kcu.table_name tableName, kcu.column_name colName, case cc.is_nullable when 'YES' then 1 else 0 end canNull from information_schema.table_constraints AS tc, information_schema.key_column_usage AS kcu, information_schema.constraint_column_usage AS ccu, information_schema.columns AS cc where 1=1 and tc.constraint_name = kcu.constraint_name and ccu.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name and cc.table_name = kcu.table_name and cc.column_name = kcu.column_name and ccu.table_name = lower( ? ) and constraint_type = 'FOREIGN KEY'

select kcu.table_name fromTableName, kcu.column_name fromColName, case cc.is_nullable when 'YES' then 1 else 0 end fromCanNull, ccu.table_name toTableName from information_schema.table_constraints AS tc, information_schema.key_column_usage AS kcu, information_schema.constraint_column_usage AS ccu, information_schema.columns AS cc where 1=1 and tc.constraint_name = kcu.constraint_name and ccu.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name and cc.table_name = kcu.table_name and cc.column_name = kcu.column_name and constraint_type = 'FOREIGN KEY'

select column_name "name", data_type "type", case when is_nullable = 'YES' then 1 else 0 end canNull, ordinal_position nomer from information_schema.columns where table_name = lower( ? ) order by ordinal_position

SELECT c.column_name FROM information_schema.table_constraints AS tc JOIN information_schema.constraint_column_usage AS ccu USING (constraint_schema, constraint_name) JOIN information_schema.columns AS c ON c.table_schema = tc.constraint_schema AND tc.table_name = c.table_name AND ccu.column_name = c.column_name WHERE constraint_type = 'PRIMARY KEY' AND tc.table_name = lower( ? ) ORDER BY c.ordinal_position
